mainBoard.name: Foundry Inspector

rulings.text: If an artifact spell has {X} in its mana cost, choose the value for X first, and then reduce the cost by {1}. For example, an artifact that costs {X} with X chosen as 4 costs {3} to cast if you control Foundry Inspector.
Once a player has announced an artifact spell, no player may take actions to try to remove Foundry Inspector from the battlefield before that spell's cost is locked in.

You draw a card no matter how Terrarion winds up in a graveyard from the battlefield.
You get the mana before you draw the card.
Terrarion’s last ability triggers no matter how it’s put into a graveyard from the battlefield.
You must choose the colors of mana Terrarion produces before its last ability has you draw a card.

mainBoard.name: Welding Sparks
mainBoard.originalText: Welding Sparks deals X damage to target creature, where X is 3 plus the number of artifacts you control.

rulings.text: If you control zero artifacts, Welding Sparks deals 3 damage to the target creature.
The number of artifacts you control is counted only as Welding Sparks resolves.

mainBoard.name: Eager Construct
mainBoard.originalText: When Eager Construct enters the battlefield, each player may scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

rulings.text: If multiple players are instructed to scry at once, such as while resolving Eager Construct's triggered ability, those players each look at the top card of their library at the same time, then they choose in turn order whether to put those cards on the top or bottom of their library.

mainBoard.text: When this creature enters, each player may scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom.)
